body_html:
Two reasons I prefer to put them together:

  1. there are two types of tests in universe, pytorch exports tests and pytorch -> onnx -> caffe2 integration tests. I think we agreed every pytorch change will trigger the tests of first type (aka test_operators.py and test_models.py), and all the expect files are used by tests of first type.
  2. All tests have used some common utilities functions in test/common.py (universe used to have a copy). If we put these tests in a separate folder, we need to continue keep a copy of these utils which I think go against the ultimate goal of code sharing.

body:
Two reasons I prefer to put them together:
1. there are two types of tests in universe, pytorch exports tests and pytorch -> onnx -> caffe2 integration tests. I think we agreed every pytorch change will trigger the tests of first type (aka test_operators.py and test_models.py), and all the expect files are used by tests of first type.
2. All tests have used some common utilities functions in test/common.py (universe used to have a copy). If we put these tests in a separate folder, we need to continue keep a copy of these utils which I think go against the ultimate goal of code sharing.
